Data: Plunkett to Warner, no run full at off stump, 136mph, pushed to the covers
Plunkett to Warner, 1 wide down the leg side, Warner misses his flick but he'll get that ball again
Plunkett to Warner, no run well bowled, a touch slower at 133kph, beats Warner's inside edge as he looks to work to the leg side, takes the pads into backward point
Plunkett to Warner, 1 run full at leg stump, flicked to long leg
Plunkett to Finch, FOUR runs just over mid-on! Aiming to drive down the ground, for a second looked as though he'd picked out Woakes, but he got enough leverage to clear his leap
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run drags the length back, worked into midwicket
Plunkett to Warner, 1 run a length ball outside off, driven to deep cover
Ali to Warner, 1 run worked off the stumps into square leg...Warner pushes for a second but it's not on
Ali to Finch, 1 run flicks a straight delivery to deep square leg
Ali to Warner, 2 runs dragged down short outside off, mistimed through backward point but gets back for the second
Ali to Warner, OUT edged, taken! Lovely stuff from Moeen. This is tighter to off stump, Warner looking to push into the off side, takes an outside edge and snaffled at slip
Ali to Smith, no run plays back to a shortish ball outside off, pushed to the covers
Ali to Smith, 1 leg bye slides into the pads, flicked around the corner...actually no bat, just thigh pad
Rashid to Smith, no run full at middle and leg, pushed to mid-on.
Rashid to Smith, 1 run full toss outside leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
Rashid to Finch, 1 wide goes for the sweep to a ball sliding down the leg side, gets the wide call
Rashid to Finch, no run flicked to midwicket
Rashid to Finch, SIX runs that's high and handsome! A full delivery, Finch stays in the crease, and lofts it cleanly straight down the ground over long-on
Rashid to Finch, 2 runs shorter, flatter, nudged behind square on the leg side and that's excellent running to make the second
Rashid to Finch, no run props forward to a full delivery and defends
Ali to Smith, 1 run taken from outside off down the ground to long-on
Ali to Finch, no run good length outside off, hint of turn, defended to the on side
Ali to Finch, 1 run shorter and straighter, worked through square leg
Ali to Smith, no run short of a length outside off, finds short third man with an open face
Ali to Smith, no run very full this time, dug out to cover
Ali to Smith, 1 run bottom hand comes into play as he reaches out and flicks this from quite wide outside off down to long-on
Rashid to Smith, SIX runs he's down the pitch and that's over the rope...didn't go as far as Finch's, but comfortably clears the long-on rope. They are after Rashid
Rashid to Smith, no run full and straight, pushed to midwicket
Rashid to Smith, 1 run full outside leg stump, givens himself a touch of room and pushes along the ground to long-on
Rashid to Finch, no run defeats him with the googly! Brings an lbw appeal. They ponder the review but decline. Just did too much I think. Umpire's call on hitting
Rashid to Finch, 1 run a firm sweep from outside leg, whistles to deep square leg
Rashid to Smith, 1 run push just wide of Rashid as he dives in his follow through and cover can't get across to save the single
Ali to Smith, 1 run full and straight, driven to long-on
Ali to Finch, no run dragged down short but Finch misses out as he pulls to short fine leg
Ali to Finch, no run an appeal for a tickle down the leg side, neat take from Buttler, but it's not out...took the pad
Ali to Finch, 1 run worked to deep midwicket
Ali to Smith, no run full outside off, drives to cover
Ali to Smith, 1 run this one turns from back of a length, tapped square into the off side...nice stuff from Moeen
Rashid to Smith, 1 run nudged off the pads through square leg
Rashid to Finch, no run sweeps from outside leg stump and finds short fine leg
Rashid to Finch, no run moves outside leg stump, pushed into the covers
Rashid to Finch, no run touch more air, fuller and middle and leg, hint of turn and defended
Rashid to Finch, no run short and a hint of width outside off, good work at short third man as Finch cuts
Rashid to Finch, 1 run this is a short one but only costs a single as he pull/sweeps to deep square leg
Ali to Finch, no run sliding down the leg-side, Finch lines up the sweep but can't connect
Ali to Finch, 2 runs bat on ball this time, a rolling sweep to backward square
Ali to Finch, 2 runs clipped into the gap at square leg, they push hard and turn for the second
Ali to Finch, 1 run stepping outside off to nurdle another single to leg
Ali to Smith, no run tucked to the leg side
Ali to Smith, 1 run flicked hard out to deep midwicket, they gallop the first but don't risk turning for another
Plunkett to Smith, 1 wide attacking the tramlines on a full length outside off, but just a tick too far outside off for the umpire's liking
Plunkett to Smith, no run punched firmly to short cover

Plunkett to Smith, no run England are very interested in this one and go up for the review. Very full length, flicking the top of the pad outside off, and was there an inside edge? Nope, it was front pad then back pad. On we go
Plunkett to Smith, 1 run a thumping drive out to deep cover
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run swivel-pulled out to the leg side, and up comes Finch's fifty. Another fine knock, to follow his Melbourne hundred. And he's going at a quicker tempo too
Plunkett to Smith, 1 run tapped to third man, through they jog
Plunkett to Finch, 2 runs width, and cut through backward point
Root to Smith, 1 run whipped off the pads, round the corner
Root to Finch, 1 run back of a length, a touch of turn, Finch works with the spin to tick off another single to leg
Root to Smith, no run angled into the leg side

Root to Smith, OUT huge appeal and Smith is pinned lbw! Unsurprisingly, he has reviewed... he was stretching onto the front foot, might it have hit him outside the line? Nope, that is trimming the top of the leg bail and what a breakthrough!
Root to Head, no run round the wicket, outside off, pushed to cover
Root to Head, no run leaning forward, tidied up at cover
Plunkett to Finch, no run onto the front foot, pushed back to the bowler
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run deflected into the leg side, another sharp single
Plunkett to Head, no run good tight wicket-to-wicket line, defended on the crease-line
Plunkett to Head, no run sweetly drilled to mid-on
Plunkett to Head, no run tapped to point
Plunkett to Head, 2 runs firmly driven, beats the diving short cover, but tidied up in the deep
Root to Finch, 1 run nudged into the leg side
Root to Head, no run round the wicket, tight line, Head slashes a cut but can't beat cover
Root to Head, no run more of the same, cramped on the cut, with a well-set off-side field
Root to Head, no run slower through the air, and Head lost his shape as he stretched into a mow! Deflects backwards towards the stumps
Root to Head, no run 'brilliant Joe!' says Buttler behind the stumps, tight line, no liberties allowed
Root to Head, 1 run pushed down the ground for a single to complete a probing over
Plunkett to Head, 2 runs flipped to leg from outside off, finds the gap behind square as Bairstow hurtles in from deep square. His shy hits the stumps but they decline the over-throw
Plunkett to Head, no run crashed into the covers, and just short of cover! Morgan throws himself forward but can't get his fingers under the ball
Plunkett to Head, 2 runs worked to the leg side to get the scoreboard moving
Plunkett to Head, no run outside off, good pace through to the keeper
Plunkett to Head, no run a crunching drive into the covers, Morgan in business again as he fields a stinging shot
Plunkett to Head, no run clipped firmly, with good timing, but straight to a deep-set mid-on
Root to Finch, no run nurdled to leg
Root to Finch, no run down on the sweep, can't get it away
Root to Finch, FOUR runs delicate deflection, that will cheer the Aussies up. A very late late cut, and rushes to the rope
Root to Finch, 1 run clipped to the leg side

Root to Head, OUT Root has another! This is a killer spell! Head lost his head, charging down the pitch but beaten in the flight, a tame popped return catch, and Australia's innings has been blown wide open by the part-timer!
Root to Marsh, no run outside off, good length, met cautiously on the front foot

Ali to Finch, 2 runs tucked to the leg side, they scamper back for the second and this is very tight... off come the bails at the very instant that Marsh slides his bat for the crease.. but he's just home, through benefit of doubt as much as anything. Close!
Ali to Finch, no run beats the edge, well bowled... in fact, there was bat on that but Buttler couldn't cling on
Ali to Finch, 1 run nudged back past the bowler
Ali to Marsh, 1 run punched to the covers
Ali to Finch, no run leaning onto the front foot, solid defence
Ali to Finch, 1 run looped up, a hint of turn, worked with the spin into the leg side
Root to Finch, no run wicket to wicket, nudged off the front pad, as far as short midwicket
Root to Finch, no run down on one knee, swept hard but straight to short fine leg. Finch curses very loudly, as well he might
Root to Finch, 1 run clipped to leg
Root to Marsh, 1 run on the pads once again, gathered at square leg
Root to Finch, (no ball) 1 run a rank full-toss, and a free hit coming up. He got away with a muffed pull to deep midwicket, but the pressure's on now...
Root to Marsh, no run a massive wind-up, but Root takes all the pace off the ball and there's no connection
Root to Marsh, no run outside off, back of a length, gathered in the covers. He's got out of that over with impressively little damage
Ali to Finch, no run tapped into the off side
Ali to Finch, 1 run flipped off the toes, gathered at short backward square
Ali to Marsh, 1 run pushed onto the back foot, punched with intent down to long-on
Ali to Finch, FOUR runs beats the field at last! Makes some room, chops a cut through backward point
Ali to Finch, 1 run another roundhouse biff, but not properly connected
Ali to Marsh, 1 run cracked off the back foot, down to wide long off
Root to Marsh, 1 run up onto the toes, cracked to cover
Root to Finch, 1 run nudged to the leg side
Root to Marsh, FOUR runs short and wide, a rare bad one from Root, who is maybe losing his magic. Slapped hard through backward point
Root to Marsh, no run back on the straight and narrow, pushed back to the bowler from a full length
Root to Marsh, 1 run closes the face to work a single to long-on
Root to Finch, 1 run tucked off the pads to square leg
Wood to Finch, no run hurried on a leg-stump line, defended off the back foot
Wood to Finch, no run on the back foot, blocked back down the pitch
Wood to Finch, 1 run nudged into the leg side
Wood to Marsh, no run well bowled, wider on the crease, speared in on a full length
Wood to Marsh, no run nothing to work with as Wood keeps it full and fast on middle and leg
Wood to Marsh, FOUR runs a fraction short, and panned through square leg. A fine over is tarnished and Wood is furious with himself
Root to Finch, 1 run clipped to the leg side
Root to Marsh, 1 run stretching onto the front foot, pushed into the covers
Root to Finch, FOUR runs crashed through the covers, Root opted for the quicker ball, but Finch made room to cut from outside leg
Root to Finch, no run round the wicket to tighten up the line
Root to Finch, 1 run swept to backward square
Root to Marsh, no run forward and blocked
Wood to Finch, 2 runs whipped off the toes, out to deep square leg and Finch pushes hard for the second
Wood to Finch, 1 run better line, but a sharp single, dropped into the off side on the back foot and an instant call
Wood to Marsh, no run worked down the ground
Wood to Marsh, no run short and sharp, good extra pace and bounce as Marsh is struck on the bicep as he climbs into a pull
Wood to Marsh, 3 runs that's a poor ball, but a fine diving stop from Rashid at fine leg to atone for the bowler. Angled down the leg and just helped on its way
Wood to Finch, no run good heat outside off, the length is the key as the ball skips through to Buttler
Root to Marsh, no run outside leg, and clipped straight to backward square
Root to Marsh, no run down the track, clipped to leg
Root to Marsh, 1 run hanging on the back foot, waiting for the ball to arrive, and punched through the off side
Root to Finch, 1 run round the wicket, dabbed off the pads
Root to Marsh, 1 run nudged to the leg side, Root's leg-side line from round the wicket really limiting the freedom of the arms
Root to Finch, no run down into position for the sweep, but can't connect. Safely outside the line so no appeal
Woakes to Marsh, no run attempted pull, but suckered by the slower ball. Scuttles through to the keeper
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run very full length, tapped to the off side, another pinched single
Woakes to Finch, 1 run short and hauled out to deep midwicket
Woakes to Marsh, 1 wide short, too short. Good aggression but there was no reaching that one
Woakes to Marsh, no run cracked down into the turf and up to backward point who intercepts with a leap
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run cracked into the leg side
Woakes to Finch, no run worked off the pads
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run twirled up outside off, cracked into the covers
Rashid to Finch, 2 runs firmly swept, good relay work on the boundary's edge to cut off the four and get the ball back quickly
Rashid to Finch, 1 run thumped into the leg side again, gathered at wide long-on
Rashid to Marsh, no run zipped through a touch flatter, patted to cover
Rashid to Marsh, 2 runs biffed hard along the ground, back through the hands of the bowler, and gathered in the deep
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run worked into the off side
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run full at off stump, pushed straight of mid-on
Woakes to Finch, 1 run a shorter delivery, he goes deep in the crease and knocks into the leg side
Woakes to Marsh, no run swing and a miss to a full ball outside off, the feet didn't really move

Woakes to Marsh, no run nicely bowled, a slower delivery, full and straight, defended with soft hands and it bobbles by his feet. Marsh intimates to pick the ball up, U-19 World Cup style. A few smiles around
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run pulled to long leg
Woakes to Finch, 1 run a one-legged pull from outside off to deep square leg
Rashid to Finch, 1 run pushes a full ball towards long-on
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run full, wider outside off, driven down to long-off
Rashid to Finch, no run a googly, on off stump, goes for the sweep and finds short fine leg
Rashid to Finch, FOUR runs that's a powerful sweep, fetches it and sends it along the ground through midwicket to bisect the men in the deep
Rashid to Finch, no run more of a paddle-sweep this time, again finds short fine-leg
Rashid to Finch, 1 run a shorter delivery, worked off the pads to deep square leg and he's on 97
Woakes to Finch, no run full at off stump, held this back a touch at 123kph, pushed with a straight bat to midwicket
Woakes to Finch, 1 leg bye short of a length, angled into the pad, deflects off the thigh guard behind square
Woakes to Marsh, no run full and straight, punched firmly into the pitch and back to the bowler
Woakes to Marsh, 1 run a short ball, pulled through square leg
Woakes to Finch, 1 run works this from well outside off into the leg side
Woakes to Marsh, no run back of a length, at off stump, another one with some pace off, pushed to backward point
Rashid to Finch, no run short fine leg is a busy man, he cuts off another sweep from Finch
Rashid to Finch, no run very full, at the toes, flicked to midwicket

Rashid to Finch, 2 runs back-to-back hundreds! A flatter, straighter, delivery, pushed out to deep square leg and he hustles back for the second. A reasonably restrained celebration. It's warm work out there and he knows Australia need more
Rashid to Finch, no run plays forward and pushes to Rashid
Rashid to Finch, 1 run gets the front foot across the crease and works a straight delivery towards square leg
Rashid to Marsh, 2 runs plays back to a shorter delivery, guides it backward of point and the sweeper can't stop the second...brings up Australia's 200
Plunkett to Finch, no run a length ball outside off, chopped off the bottom edge into the crease
Plunkett to Finch, no run he's aiming into row Z with this one, has a huge wind up outside off at full delivery and doesn't make contact
Plunkett to Finch, 2 runs full and straighter, worked off the pads deep into the leg side. Good running
Plunkett to Finch, 1 wide slips this down the leg side, an angry cry from Plunkett
Plunkett to Finch, 1 run back outside off stump, short of a length, worked towards mid-on
Plunkett to Marsh, FOUR runs doesn't connect cleanly, but gets the boundary to deep midwicket...short outside off, strongly pulled
Plunkett to Marsh, no run back of a length outside off, Plunkett keeps the length short, bobbles off the face towards the keeper
Rashid to Finch, 1 run hint of a leading edge about this as he shapes to play to the leg side

Rashid to Marsh, OUT he's gone now! He knew he had to press the accelerator, he charges out of his crease, nowhere near the ball, has a swing across the line, misses and it's a simple stumping for Buttler
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run not sure he picked that googly, pushing forward and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
Rashid to Finch, no run nudges a shorter delivery towards midwicket, can't find the gap
Rashid to Finch, 1 run swept from outside off to deep square
Rashid to Stoinis, 2 runs a delicate paddle-sweep, takes this from well wide of off stump, down to fine leg

Plunkett to Finch, OUT finds mid-on! Once again, England strike back-to-back...went to drive down the ground, think he wanted to go over top, got no sort of elevation and it's a simple catch on the edge of the circle
Plunkett to White, no run short of a length outside off, quick adjustment of length to the new batsman, defended to backward point
Plunkett to White, no run a short ball over leg stump, he ducks to allow it through to the keeper
Plunkett to White, 1 wide another wide down the leg side, he's had a few today, although that's a pretty tight call...not far from leg stump
Plunkett to White, 1 run tight run! Pushed into midwicket and that's a uncertain single
Plunkett to Stoinis, no run pushed into the covers
Plunkett to Stoinis, 1 run touch fuller, he hangs back in the crease and drives to deep cover...good over from Plunkett
Rashid to Stoinis, no run full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
Rashid to Stoinis, OUT given caught behind! That's a lovely piece of bowling, England on the charge. Floated up on off stump, draws Stonis forward, spins away as he drives and it's a thin snick
Rashid to Carey, 1 run slides off the face of the bat into backward point
Rashid to White, 1 run swept from outside off to deep square
Rashid to Carey, no run goes for the sweep, gets taken on the front pad
Rashid to Carey, 1 run connects with this sweep, sends it behind square
Plunkett to Carey, no run full outside off, defended towards point
Plunkett to Carey, no run can't get this into a gap
Plunkett to Carey, 1 wide another wide, full down the leg side
Plunkett to Carey, no run short of a length outside off, nicely timed square of the wicket but straight to point
Plunkett to Carey, no run fuller, at off stump, Carey gets forward and can only play it back to the bowler
Plunkett to Carey, 1 run swings across the line of a back-of-a-length delivery, out to deep square leg
Plunkett to White, no run full outside off, pushed into the on side, Root dives across from midwicket...another dot ball
Rashid to Carey, no run beats him outside off with one that slides across him
Rashid to Carey, FOUR runs gets across outside off and sweeps strongly behind square, excellent placement this time
Rashid to Carey, FOUR runs he sweeps again, it's a slightly shorter delivery, and gets this one fine over the vacant short fine leg area...very nicely done
Rashid to Carey, 1 run and now he reverse sweeps, goes very fine, just wide of the keeper...off the glove
Rashid to White, 1 run this time White attempts the reverse, gets a bottom edge and Buttler does very well to stick a boot out...could have run away
Rashid to Carey, 1 wide sees this sliding down the leg side so leaves it alone and gets the extra ball
Rashid to Carey, 1 run a googly outside off, cut to deep cover
Wood to Carey, no run back of a length, straight at 140kph, played to the leg side
Wood to Carey, 1 run full at leg stump, he moves to the leg side but can only tap this to the covers
Wood to White, 1 run a short ball, well-directed at off stump, he's through the pull and gets taken on the shoulder
Wood to Carey, no run and now he's full at the stumps, some pace off at 124kph, can't find a gap on the leg side
Wood to Carey, 1 run fuller still, at middle and leg, flicked to deep square
Wood to White, 1 run works a length delivery out to deep midwicket...a superb over, full of variation and skill, from Wood
Rashid to White, 1 run goes for the reverse again, gets it wide of Buttler this time but can't beat short third man
Rashid to Carey, FOUR runs another excellent shot from Carey, takes this from outside off and slog-sweeps wide of long-on
Rashid to Carey, 1 run cuts this off the stumps straight to point but is able to steal the single
Rashid to White, no run uses his feet, can't get to the pitch and pushes to cover
Rashid to White, 1 run out of his crease again, this time he meets it on the full but it's only a single driven to long-off
Rashid to Carey, FOUR runs that's magnificent! Touch of class about that, too full outside off, he drives in the air over cover and wide of long-off
Wood to White, 2 runs gives himself a touch of room outside leg stump and drives strongly to the cover sweeper
Wood to White, 1 run a short delivery, into the pitch, he swipes to the leg side and gets a bottom edge
Wood to Carey, 1 run 128kph, heaves a length ball into midwicket
Wood to White, 1 run moving to the leg side, Wood goes shorter, dragged to deep square leg...struggling to find the middle
Wood to Carey, no run a short delivery outside off, 142kph, beats the under edge as he goes for the pull
Wood to Carey, 1 run gets hold of this back-of-a-length delivery but finds deep midwicket
Woakes to Carey, 1 run good length outside leg stump, worked off the pads to deep midwicket
Woakes to White, no run goes right across the crease, tries to flick this away, does make contact, glances the pad through to Buttler...there's a query for lbw
Woakes to White, no run this time he moves outside leg, goes too far, then can't reach a full delivery speared outside off

Woakes to White, OUT that's why England warm-up with football! Great skills from Woakes. Superb from him all-round, in fact. Firstly he out-smarted White with a slower-ball bouncer which was bottom edged into the crease, Carey came through for the run, Woakes followed through and right-footed into the stumps
Woakes to Starc, no run good length at the pads, misses his flick and gets taken on the pads. Another dot
Woakes to Starc, no run back of a length, straight, pushed to the covers
Wood to White, 1 run this one is crunched, one bounce to deep square leg
Wood to Starc, 1 run shorter on the hip, flicked to fine leg
Wood to White, 1 run back of a length into the pitch, White almost swinging himself off his feet, only a single as he pulls to deep midwicket
Wood to Starc, 1 run goes fuller, at the stumps, squeezed out through the leg side and deep square stops the second
Wood to White, 1 run wide outside off, White swings and gets a toe end down the ground

Wood to Starc, 1 run dropped at deep midwicket by Root! Did he lose it in the sun? Got into a horrible tangle. Short of a length, swung strongly, almost straight down Root's throat and he palms it down. Still, only a single
Woakes to Starc, OUT this time he's taken at deep midwicket! Roy this time. Good length, bit of pace off, Starc tries to clear the leg side and can't get the distance needed
Woakes to White, 1 run full and straight, superb, driven to mid-on
Woakes to Tye, 2 runs short of a length, connects cleanly as he swings this out to deep midwicket
Woakes to Tye, no run a bouncer, beats him over the top edge as he goes for the pull
Woakes to Tye, SIX runs gets this over the rope! It's a low full toss, he uses his power and thumps it over wide long-on

Woakes to Tye, OUT direct hit! Dot ball and a wicket to end. Woakes goes short, Tye bottom edges into the crease, they go for the run, Woakes is quickly on it in his follow through then spins around and hits direct at the non-striker's end

Well, what do we make of that from Australia? Apart from Aaron Finch, it felt pretty ordinary. However, all credit to England. They bowled very impressively, spin playing a key role with Root chipping in with two wickets, and Eoin Morgan's captaincy and tactics were outstanding. England didn't have any problem chasing over 300 a few days ago so they'll be hugely confident
Welcome back. Here come England's openers. 271 is the target. Mitchell Starc is armed with the new ball. Jason Roy is on strike, fresh from an England-record 180 at the MCG
Starc to Roy, no run outside off, shades of swing, left alone with a flourish
Starc to Roy, 2 runs swing again, shaping into the right-hander's pads, deflected fine
Starc to Roy, no run better line, bending into middle and off, and forcefully defended on the front foot
Starc to Hales, no run full and straight, dug out on the crease with caution
Starc to Hales, no run outside off, good aggressive line, left alone
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run outswing on a full length, encouraging pace
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run sharp again, ducking into the right hander, and pushed to the leg side off the back foot
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, FOUR runs full length, outswing, read early and Bairstow's supreme timing comes to the fore to pierce the covers with quick hands
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run jeepers, how did that miss! Fast and full, and Bairstow was beaten for pace, under-edging a defensive push off the toe of his bat and past the off stump!
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run forward again, this is genuinely brisk from Richardson, skidding low from a low trajectory
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run punched off the back foot to mid-off. A very fine first over from the new boy
Starc to Hales, no run a long-levered drive into the covers, smothered with a dive
Starc to Hales, FOUR runs short, and pumped with firm forearms through midwicket. That sat up and begged
Starc to Hales, no run dabbed to cover
Starc to Hales, FOUR runs a loose full toss outside off. That's a rank delivery from a fine bowler, and Hales picks his spot, behind square on the off side, with a dismissive slap
Starc to Hales, 1 run better areas, full and straight with a hint of inswing, but Hales taps and goes, teasing mid-off with a cheeky single
Starc to Bairstow, no run width, and steered to point with loose hands
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run met on the front foot and pushed to cover
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run brisk again, 144.6kph, met on the back foot with a cautious jab
Jhye Richardson to Hales, 1 run drilled to cover, another sharp single to Warner who shies at the non-striker's stumps but to no avail
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run full and straight, cautious defence on the back foot
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run full again and firmly spanked back down the pitch, but Richardson drops his hands on the ball to intercept
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, no run outside off, and jabbed to point
Starc to Hales, FOUR runs too wide again from Starc, and Hales just uses the pace to glide a cut past point
Starc to Hales, no run on the back foot, defended with a hop
Starc to Hales, 1 run short, and wafted out to deep midwicket, looks as though he opted against a full-blooded mow, with the man back on the rope

Starc to Bairstow, FOUR runs too short, too wide. Starc is not getting it right often enough in this spell, and Bairstow batters a cut through point. No swing back into the right-hander, so the wider line is a freebie
Starc to Bairstow, FOUR runs that's sublime. Fuller length, tighter line, drilled through the covers

Starc to Bairstow, no run sharp bouncer and that's cracked Bairstow on the side of the grille like a right hook! He's fine, the lid does its job as the ball bobbles into the gully. Actually, it looked like the breastbone on second viewing.
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run tight line, defended
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run worked into the off side
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run tight line, solid defence
Jhye Richardson to Hales, FOUR runs clobbered through the covers! Pace, but no movement, and the faster it hits the bat, the faster it comes off...
Jhye Richardson to Hales, 1 run outside off, steered down to third man
Jhye Richardson to Bairstow, 2 runs guided to midwicket with a roll of the wrists
Head to Hales, FOUR runs round the wicket, too short, too wide, pumped through point. Not a good start
Head to Hales, no run round the wicket, aping Root's line on leg stump, and duly defended
Head to Hales, no run tapped into the off side
Head to Hales, FOUR runs swept supremely! Looping onto a middle and leg line, and clumped on the up, over backward square. Played entirely on length
Head to Hales, 1 run punched with high elbows to mid-on, thoughts of a second, but not this time
Head to Bairstow, no run forward, and pushed to mid-off
Tye to Hales, no run tidy line and length
Tye to Hales, no run blocked on a middle and leg line, angled into the right hander on a full length
Tye to Hales, no run good areas once again, bending into the top of the stumps as Hales attempts a squeeze through third man
Tye to Hales, no run on the back foot, poked to cover
Tye to Hales, no run defended back down the line of the ball. Good tight restrictive line
Tye to Hales, FOUR runs over-ptiched and clouted along the ground, through the covers! Excellent opportunistic batting, waiting for the error and cashing in with aplomb!
Head to Bairstow, no run a big appeal but Bairstow is so far down the track that it is guesswork... Smith declines the review, though it might have been tight...
Head to Bairstow, 2 runs swept square
Head to Bairstow, FOUR runs another sweep, finer on this occasion, but it was way outside leg and a no-risk opportunity for the batsman to have a swing
Head to Bairstow, no run pumped in the air, past the diving bowler
Head to Bairstow, no run forward and worked out to point
Head to Bairstow, 1 run eased into the gap to keep the strike
Tye to Bairstow, no run eased into the off side
Tye to Bairstow, no run good change of pace, Bairstow has to adjust late in order to time his defensive push
Tye to Bairstow, no run banged in short and straight, through to the keeper who gives a tap of applause as he gathers
Tye to Bairstow, no run worked into the off side once more
Tye to Bairstow, FOUR runs too short, crashed on the up through backward point. England are doling out the lessons with every error in length
Tye to Bairstow, no run fuller and straighter, blocked this time
Head to Hales, 1 run over the wicket this time, tapped out past the diving short cover
Head to Bairstow, 1 run looped up and dipping outside off, flogged with lots of bottom hand into the leg side
Head to Hales, 1 run back of a length, stabbed past short midwicket who half-stops with a dive
Head to Bairstow, FOUR runs that is utterly panned, another nailed sweep out through square leg
Head to Bairstow, 1 run flicked into the leg side
Head to Hales, no run leaning onto the front foot to defend
Tye to Bairstow, no run another tight line to Bairstow who squares up in defence
Tye to Bairstow, 3 runs a crazy miscue from Bairstow, suckered by the slower ball, and somehow middled a checked shot, high up and over the cover ring, and almost all the way to the boundary
Tye to Hales, 1 wide short and aggressive. Too short...
Tye to Hales, no run a glided drive out to point
Tye to Hales, 1 run on the back foot, worked to the leg side
Tye to Bairstow, FOUR runs too short, too wide, too repetitive from Australia's quicks. Interspersing excellent deliveries with rank long-hops, and England are cruising at the moment
Tye to Bairstow, 1 run fuller, straighter, punched to cover
Finch to Bairstow, 1 run worked into the gap, too wide to be a threat
Finch to Hales, 1 run punched into the covers
Finch to Bairstow, FOUR runs short, and hauled over midwicket with all the time in the world
Finch to Bairstow, 1 run eased out to cover
Finch to Hales, no run better ball, leaning forward to defend
Finch to Hales, no run angled bat, out to midwicket. A curate's egg of an over
Tye to Bairstow, 1 run short, a short-arm pull out to midwicket
Tye to Hales, 2 runs short again, pulled down and across, rolling the wrists to control the stroke
Tye to Hales, no run opens the face, guides out to point
Tye to Hales, 2 runs outside off, an edge, but perfectly safe with no cordon... but hang on, there's a shy from third man and the bails are off... nope... just made it home
Tye to Hales, no run solidly forward, poked to point
Tye to Hales, 1 run nudged into the leg side, another pilfered single
Finch to Hales, no run round the wicket, glided out to point
Finch to Hales, no run punched back to the bowler
Finch to Hales, 2 runs eased on the up, into the gap at midwicket
Finch to Hales, no run on the back foot, middle and leg line, pushed off the back foot
Finch to Hales, no run well bowled, a teasing line on middle, defended
Finch to Hales, no run flicked urgently to midwicket, and just two from the over. Good control from Finch
Starc to Bairstow, 1 run on the back foot, worked to the leg side
Starc to Hales, 1 run too short again, pumped along the ground to the midwicket sweeper
Starc to Bairstow, 1 run defended on the back foot, out to midwicket
Starc to Hales, no run solidly into line
Starc to Hales, 1 run short and pulled again out through square leg
Starc to Bairstow, FOUR runs battered down the ground, a one-bounce four, and that is an outstanding initiative-seizing fifty for Bairstow. And it's the hundred up as well
Finch to Hales, 1 wide
Finch to Hales, SIX runs easy levers from Hales, a mighty wallop up and over long-on, and there is his fifty as well!
Finch to Hales, 1 run good length this time, drawn onto the front foot to block
Finch to Bairstow, no run solidly forward, almost stereotypically diligent in defence
Finch to Bairstow, no run eased into the off side
Finch to Bairstow, no run punched to cover
Finch to Bairstow, no run big appeal, but sliding down on the angle
Starc to Hales, 1 run wide outside off, cut to deep cover
Starc to Bairstow, no run very full this time, jabbed to backward point with an open face
Starc to Bairstow, 2 runs short on leg stump, he rolls his wrists and pulls to long leg...and there's his pace between the wickets, Bairstow makes that into a second. Always pushing
Starc to Bairstow, 2 runs he drags this a little, drives at a fullish delivery, the bat face twists and it's in the air but straight of mid-on
Starc to Bairstow, 1 run full outside off, opens the face and runs to third man
Starc to Hales, 1 run gets over the top of this short one and pulls through square leg
Stoinis to Hales, no run full outside off, beats the inside edge as he plays a slightly loose prod
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run short of a length outside off, angled to third man
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run finds backward point
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run a bouncer over off stump, left alone
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 run back of a length, a short-arm jab out to deep midwicket
Stoinis to Hales, 1 run flips a short ball down towards long leg, not a million miles from carrying but safe in the end
Jhye Richardson to Hales, no run a good short ball, well-directed over middle stump, follows Hales a little as he sways out of the line
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run good length outside off, left alone
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run touch fuller, starts outside off and shapes back a touch, 142kph, defended to cover
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run tight line and length, back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run fuller outside off, driven square to point...Richardson returns with a wicket maiden
Stoinis to Bairstow, no run he's through his pull shot a little early, skids under the bottom edge
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 wide a very short bouncer this time, loops over Bairstow's head. Called wide
Stoinis to Bairstow, 2 runs connects with the pull this time, places it behind square
Stoinis to Bairstow, 1 leg bye keeps it short, Bairstow takes a blow on the shoulder as he attempts another pull...the ball bobbles towards backward point
Stoinis to Root, no run full outside off, gets forward and plays to cover
Stoinis to Root, no run short of a length, pushed off the back foot to point
Stoinis to Root, 1 run full outside off, drives to deep cover
Jhye Richardson to Root, FOUR runs that's a wonderful piece of timing and placement, takes advantage of a hint of width and drives between cover and backward point
Jhye Richardson to Root, 1 run very similar shot, driven off the back foot, deep point has gone out
Jhye Richardson to Morgan, no run gets an inside edge on a good length ball, this is good stuff from Richardson
Jhye Richardson to Morgan, no run angled across outside off, left alone
Jhye Richardson to Morgan, no run good length at middle and leg, pushed into the leg side from the inside part of the bat
Head to Root, 1 run round the wicket, pushed towards point and that's a scampered single
Head to Morgan, FOUR runs just wide of backward point! Width from Head, Morgan goes for the cut, goes in the air but fine of the diving fielder - Warner
Head to Morgan, no run fuller, at off stump, defended
Head to Morgan, FOUR runs too short, he rocks back deep in his crease and pulls over midwicket
Head to Morgan, no run back on a good length, defended
Head to Morgan, no run pushes through a little quick, played off the back foot to the bowler
Jhye Richardson to Root, 1 run back of a length outside off, driven to deep point
Jhye Richardson to Morgan, SIX runs just short of a length on the hip, he flip-pulls it high over deep backward square leg. Sweet timing
Jhye Richardson to Morgan, no run good length, defended
Jhye Richardson to Morgan, no run very full, just outside off, jabbed back to the bowler
Jhye Richardson to Morgan, no run full and straight, defended to the bowler
Jhye Richardson to Morgan, 1 run on the pads, loops in the air as Morgan pushes to the leg side but short of mid-on
Head to Morgan, no run round the wicket, full at leg stump, he plays forward
Head to Morgan, 2 runs shorter outside off, he drives through the covers off the back foot wide of the sweeper
Head to Morgan, no run on the stumps, blocked
Head to Morgan, no run full and straight, defended
Head to Morgan, 1 run leans forward, takes the inside edge to the leg side
Head to Root, 1 run bunted down the ground to long-on
Starc to Root, no run good length outside off, angled to backward point
Starc to Root, 1 run width outside off, he leans back and square drives to deep point
Starc to Morgan, no run back of a length at off stump, 142kph, defended to cover
Starc to Morgan, no run full and straight, driven back to the bowler
Starc to Morgan, 2 runs full, width outside off, he square drives behind point, not quite perfectly timed and third man gets around
Starc to Morgan, no run back at the stumps, full length, driven to mid-off
Tye to Root, 1 run full and straight, worked through midwicket
Tye to Morgan, no run good length outside off, driven to cover
Tye to Morgan, no run gets a leading edge towards mid-off as he tries to work a straight ball to the leg side
Tye to Morgan, no run full and straight, driven towards mid-on
Tye to Morgan, 1 run a slower ball, comes out as a full toss which is driven to deep cover...ruled to be under waist height
Tye to Root, 2 runs full and straight, flicked through midwicket
Starc to Buttler, no run greets Buttler with a bouncer which he ducks underneath
Starc to Buttler, 1 run full outside off, pushed into the covers and he sprints through to get off the mark
Starc to Root, no run back of a length at off stump, played to the on side
Starc to Root, 1 run shorter, outside leg stump, shoveled around the corner with his bottom hand coming off the bat
Starc to Buttler, no run short at leg stump, he ducks
Tye to Root, 2 runs worked off the pads through square leg
Tye to Root, 1 run full outside off, driven to deep cover
Tye to Buttler, 1 run full, wide outside off, Buttler reaches out for it and drives to the sweeper
Tye to Root, no run good length, pushed to mid-off
Tye to Root, 1 run goes full and straight, clipped to long leg
Tye to Buttler, no run full at off stump, a firm drive finds mid-off...good little period for Australia
Starc to Root, no run good length outside off, pushed to cover
Starc to Root, 1 run fuller, he gets forward and drives to deep cover
Starc to Buttler, no run back of a length, straight, defended to the leg side
Starc to Buttler, 2 runs there's the short one, Buttler pulls through midwicket
Starc to Buttler, 1 run short again, on the hip, worked down to long leg
Starc to Root, 1 run another short one, a slower bouncer, Root pulls to deep midwicket
Tye to Root, 1 run short of a length outside off, angled to third man
Tye to Buttler, 1 run full and straight, strongly flicked towards midwicket who is annoyed with himself that he can't prevent it escaping for a single
Tye to Root, 1 run tucks a straight delivery off the pads through midwicket...under 100 needed
Tye to Buttler, FOUR runs short and that's superb placement, gets it quickly to ground - didn't bounce very high - and sends it wide of long leg
Tye to Buttler, no run goes fuller, at off stump, flicked to the on side
Tye to Buttler, no run goes for another pull, was outside off this time and it beats him under the bottom edge
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run good length at off stump, defended to cover
Jhye Richardson to Root, 2 runs a touch fuller, Root whips a straight delivery through midwicket
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run fuller, driven back to the bowler
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run wide on the crease, full at off stump, dug out to backward point
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run pushes a full delivery to cover who is quite close
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run another full one finds cover...an excellent over from the impressive Richardson
Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR runs that's a way to greet the returning bowler! Pumps a full delivery over mid-off
Stoinis to Buttler, no run drags the length, angled in the pads
Stoinis to Buttler, 2 runs full and straight, this stroke is a little more ungainly as he heaves across the line through midwicket
Stoinis to Buttler, no run short outside off, left alone
Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR runs gets some fortune here! Pulls this short delivery and it flies off the top edge over the keeper
Stoinis to Buttler, no run another short one, he opts for caution this time and sways out of the line
Jhye Richardson to Root, 2 runs full and straight, slips into the pads, clipped fine
Jhye Richardson to Root, 1 run again he's flicking a full, straight delivery, this time it goes squarer
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 2 runs clipped off the pads to long leg
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 1 wide short of a length, pushed down the leg side
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, no run short outside off, left alone
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, 2 runs the bottom hand takes over as he fetches this from well outside to deep square
Jhye Richardson to Buttler, FOUR runs and there's a bit more of Buttler, come over to my side again, swings a full delivery high over midwicket and wide of mid-on
Head to Root, 1 run
Head to Buttler, 1 run keeps a touch low on off stump, flicked off the back foot to midwicket
Head to Root, 2 runs flicked into the leg side once more
Head to Root, no run open-faced drive into the covers, well pounced by White
Head to Root, 1 run a closed-faced steer down to long-on
Head to Buttler, FOUR runs battered through the gap at midwicket! Oodles of bottom hand swinging through the line to take any threat of a fielder out of the equation. England keep marching on
Starc to Root, 1 run onto the front foot, eased into the covers
Starc to Buttler, 1 run round the wicket, very full length outside off, chopped down through third man
Starc to Root, 1 run forward and drilled to cover
Starc to Buttler, no run very full length, round the wicket, squeezed into the covers
Starc to Buttler, 2 runs short, and picked up so early, a roundhouse pull out to deep midwicket
Starc to Buttler, 1 run eased into the covers once more
Head to Buttler, 3 runs chipped, ever so briefly, in the air and through the covers
Head to Root, 1 run striding onto the front foot and worked down to long-on
Head to Buttler, 1 run outside off, chopped through point
Head to Root, 1 run on the pads again, flicked to leg
Head to Buttler, 1 run on the back foot, clubbed down to long-on
Head to Root, 2 runs big stride, full swing of the blade, solid contact into the covers
Starc to Buttler, 1 wide down the leg side
Starc to Ali, 1 run tapped into the covers, a quick single to get the account open
Starc to Root, 1 run Starc is settling into an ominous rhythm now, round the wicket, very full, every ball a bullet. But he's got just three balls left...
Starc to Woakes, no run full once again, from round the wicket, but Woakes is equal to the task this time. Props forward to shut the door

Starc to Woakes, 1 run punched into the covers, Woakes is off the mark, and Starc's spell is done. Took some tap from Bairstow and Hales but his wicket-taking has kept Australia's fingertips in the contest
Tye to Woakes, no run slower ball, tapped back down the pitch
Tye to Woakes, no run outside off, a hint of inswing, but kept out with hasty adjustment
Tye to Woakes, 1 run worked into the gap once more, singles will suffice for England
Tye to Root, no run looking for the single as Root drops the ball as his feet, but Australia's close fielders swoop
Tye to Root, no run nibble off the seam again, reverse swing and extra bounce. It's getting tricky out there now... but Australia's quicks are running out of overs
Tye to Root, 2 runs eased into the covers, that's a good riposte, head over the ball and finding enough of a gap to relieve the pressure
Jhye Richardson to Woakes, no run angled bat, defended out to point
Jhye Richardson to Woakes, 1 run stand and swat. Woakes has a mow from his stance, but inside-edges into the leg side, beaten by a hint of late inswing. Good bowling
Jhye Richardson to Root, no run fuller length, driven to short cover
Jhye Richardson to Root, 1 run a sharp shy from Smith in the covers, but to no avail
Jhye Richardson to Woakes, FOUR runs tailing back into the stumps, and that's a very fine open-faced drive into the gap in the covers. Goes all the way and that changes things

Jhye Richardson to Woakes, SIX runs superb from Woakes! Hanging on the back foot, sensing the adjustment in length after a fractional over-pitch, and sure enough, he dumps Richardson's next ball over cow corner to wreck the over's work
Tye to Root, no run chopped firmly to backward point
Tye to Root, 1 run cut into the off side
Tye to Woakes, no run crunched into the covers
Tye to Woakes, no run eased to the off side
Tye to Woakes, no run on the back foot, tucked to leg
Tye to Woakes, 3 runs over-pitched, and Woakes once again produces an admirable shot in the circumstances, an open-faced steer into the gap at extra cover. It's almost done here, you sense...
Jhye Richardson to Woakes, 1 run short, an uncertain pull, but safely placed into no-man's land at midwicket
Jhye Richardson to Root, 1 run dead-batted defence, down into the crease. And another sharp single
Jhye Richardson to Woakes, no run angled defence back down the pitch
Jhye Richardson to Woakes, no run blocked on a full length

Jhye Richardson to Woakes, FOUR runs back of a length, pulled round the corner and ... whoops, that's a tremendous blooper from Stoinis, who slides, attempts to gather, lets the ball elude his grasp, and watches it trickle over the rope
Jhye Richardson to Woakes, no run outside off, and an attempted thrash through the covers
Stoinis to Root, 1 run on the pads, clipped through the leg side
Stoinis to Woakes, 2 runs back of a length, pumped down the ground with a cross-batted mow, takes a bit of a top edge but eludes the field
Stoinis to Woakes, FOUR runs short, and slammed! A brilliant pull, going from high to low, nailed clean through square leg to reduce the requirement to 11
Stoinis to Woakes, 1 run open the face, angle the shot, down to third man
Stoinis to Root, no run defended into the off side
Stoinis to Root, 1 run on the back foot, glided into the off side
Marsh to Root, no run full length, attempted drill back past the bowler, but not quite timed
Marsh to Root, 1 run short and through midwicket
Marsh to Woakes, no run solid defence, back down the track
Marsh to Woakes, no run back foot block, pushed to cover
Marsh to Woakes, no run on the pads, attempted flick, can't get this one through
Marsh to Woakes, 3 runs up and over the covers, a shackle-breaking slap to reduce the requirement to within a single blow
Stoinis to Woakes, FOUR runs up and over point, leaning back and timing the pants off his uppercut! Scores are level...
Stoinis to Woakes, FOUR runs pumped up and over long-on, plugs in the deep, trickles to the rope, and England have secured a tremendous win
8.47pm England have won their first ODI at Brisbane since 1999, and they have taken an emphatic 2-0 lead without really being stretched in two apparently daunting chases.
"Richo bowled pretty well, perhaps [we should have played a spinner]. This wicket is different to the one we had for the Test match."
"We have a level of trust and confidence in the group that someone will put their hand up for us."
"Whenever you come off a series loss you want to prove a point, and leading into the World Cup we want to set a benchmark. We had to stay cool in the moment and get the job done."

9.02pm Right, that's your lot. Thanks for joining us today, have a read of Dan Brettig's report and join us again on Sunday for the third ODI in Sydney, where Australia desperately need a win to stay alive in the series.
England won by 4 wickets (with 34 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Joe Root, ENG
